content.description: Head up the left side of a beautiful, short slab following a 1-inch corner crack. Above the slab head up through broken terrain to the left of a bulge, followed by some briefly blank rock just before the chains.
content.location: Starts on a short pedestal located uphill from the main face, just past the bushes on the right past which the trail leads.

content.description: A fun beginning, with a couple of finger locks, leads to edges and an occasional pocket, as the route ascends just left of a bulge. Sidepulls and edges lead past the bulge with a slight rightward jog to the anchors.
content.location: The left-most of the lines on the wall.

content.description: Tricky start with thin, difficult-to-find holds through the first three bolts, then some sidepulling trickery leads to pockets and a ledge. Trend right following the rock with a bit of a weird, unnerving finish at the chains.
content.location: The second-from-left line. Starts to the left of a large evergreen and heads over a small roof at the second bolt.

content.description:
An enjoyable start on huge pockets leads to a moment or two of balancy indecision, followed by a good rest at an almost-ledge. Continue up past a slight bulge into lighter, more fractured rock. From the seventh bolt trend a bit left towards the last bolt using balance, a key right hand, and faith that holds will be found.

From the last bolt a bit of strenuous trickery is required to reach the chains. The end may be a bit harder if you're shorter.
content.location: The right-most line on the buttress before you head around the corner and uphill.

content.description:
A slightly tricky start leads to a narrow ledge about halfway up. An initially blank-seeming face reveals glorious pockets and leads to a wonderful and intimidating roof with some balancy moves using tricky-to-find handholds. The final bit to the chains requires a bit of thought and body positioning.

Going straight over the roof is more rewarding, but a bit harder than following the path of least resistance.
content.location: Starts between two large evergreen trees. The third line from the left on the buttress.
